scenario:
T-Mobile US reported fourth-quarter and full-year 2024 earnings that exceeded analyst consensus estimates. Key highlights include:

- Earnings per share (EPS) of $2.57, up 54% year over year, compared to the analyst estimate of $2.29.
- Revenue of $21.9 billion, exceeding the predicted $21.3 billion.
- Net income of $2.98 billion, a 48% increase from last year.
- Core adjusted EBITDA of $7.9 billion, a 10.1% increase from last year.
- Postpaid net customer additions of 1.93 million, a 19% increase from last year.
- Record postpaid phone net additions of 903,000 in the fourth quarter.
- Postpaid phone churn rate decreased to a record low of 0.92%.
- Service revenue climbed to $16.9 billion in the fourth quarter, a 6% increase year over year.
- High-speed internet services saw 428,000 new customers, closing the year with 6.4 million internet customers.

T-Mobile management projects continued growth for 2025, with postpaid net customer additions expected to range between 5.5 million and 6.0 million, and core adjusted EBITDA expected to fall between $33.1 billion and $33.6 billion. Net cash from operating activities is expected to be between $26.8 billion and $27.5 billion, and adjusted free cash flow is expected to be between $17.3 billion and $18.0 billion.
